elements.text:
Types of Data
1) Numerical - represents some quantity
     a) Discrete
     b) Continuous
2) Categorical - represents some quality
     a) Gender, Race, Product Category
3) Ordinal - mixture of quantiy and quality
     a) Ratings, Rank

1) Mean - average µ = Σ (X) / n 2) Median - sort the values, and take the middle(odd number of data) or mean of the middles(even number of data) 3) Mode - most column value in a data set 4) Varience - average of the squared differences from mean σ2 = Σ(X - µ) ** 2 / n 5) Standard Deviation - square root of the varience 6) Sample Varience - where while average we do -1 of total elements S2 = Σ(X - µ) ** 2 / (n-1) 7) Percentile : indicates the value below which a given percentage of observations in a group falls 8) Moments - Mean, Varience, Skew, Kurtosis 9) Covariance -

Machine learning is a field of study that gives computers the ability to learn without being programmed.
Main algorithms are : 1) Supervised learning 2) Unsupervised learning 3) Recommendor systems 4) Reinforcement learning

Machine will learn from x -> y (input -> output) mappings.
We give algorithm, both inputs and outputs, it will learn from being given right answers
Algorithms: 1) Regression (predict a number, infinitely many possible outputs) i) Linear regression ii) Cost function iii) Gradient descendant 2) Classificatoin (predict categories, small number of possible outputs)
Applications: 1) Spam filtering 2) Speech recognition 3) Translation systems 4) Visual inspection

Find something interesting, in unlabeled data
Algorithm needs to fine the structure of data

Algorighms: 1) Clustering (groups the data into clusters) 2) Anamoly detection (find unusual data points) 3) Dimensionality reduction (compress data using fewer numbers)

1) Linear regression : f(x) = mx + b
2) Cost function : J(w,b) = 1/2m Σ(i=1 to m) (f(xi) - yi)**2
